issue.message: Use of LayoutInflater.from(Context) detected. Consider using layoutInflater instead
Expecting an activity to have `android.intent.category.LEANBACK_LAUNCHER` intent filter
The locale folder "`he`" should be called "`iw`" instead; see the `java.util.Locale` documentation
The locale folder "`id`" should be called "`in`" instead; see the `java.util.Locale` documentation
autoRevokePermissions has no effect; this flag was only used in preview versions of Android 11
Use `@RequiresApi(Build.VERSION_CODES.R) instead of `@TargetApi` to propagate the requirement to users of `AdbPairingService`
For locale "cs" (Czech) the following quantity should also be defined: `many` (e.g. "10.0 dne")
For locale "pt" (Portuguese) the following quantity should also be defined: `many`
For locale "es" (Spanish) the following quantity should also be defined: `many`
For locale "fr" (French) the following quantity should also be defined: `many` (e.g. "1000000 de jours")

issue.errorLine1: <string name="home_adb_title"><![CDATA[Start by connecting to a computer]]></string>
read the help.]]>

%1$s

* There are some other considerations, please confirm that you have read the help first.]]>

In addition, Stellar can be started automatically on boot without root if WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission is granted.

Please view the step-by-step guide first.]]>
<string name="home_wireless_adb_description_pre_11"><![CDATA[Before Android 11, connecting to a computer is required to enable Wireless debugging.]]></string>

<string name="dialog_adb_discovery_message">Please enable \"Wireless debugging\" in \"Developer options\". \"Wireless debugging\" is automatically disabled when network changes.\n\nNote, do not disable \"Developer options\" or \"USB debugging\", or Stellar will be stopped.</string>
<string name="dialog_adb_discovery_message_toggle_wireless_debugging">Please try to disable and enable \"Wireless debugging\" if it keeps searching.</string>
<string name="dialog_adb_invalid_port">Port is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.</string>
<string name="cannot_connect_port">Can\'t connect to wireless debugging service.</string>
<string name="dialog_wireless_adb_not_enabled">Wireless debugging is not enabled.\nNote, before Android 11, to enable wireless debugging, computer connection is a must.</string>

<string name="dialog_adb_pairing_message">Please start paring by the following steps: \"Developer Options\" - \"Wireless debugging\" - \"Pairing device using pairing code\".\n\nAfter the pairing process starts, you will able to input the pairing code.</string>

<string name="adb_pairing_requires_multi_window_reason">The system requires the pairing dialog always visible, using split-screen mode is the only way to let this app and system dialog visible at the same time.</string>
<string name="adb_error_key_store">Unable to generate key for wireless debugging.\nThis may be because KeyStore mechanism of this device is broken.</string>
<string name="adb_pair_required">Please go through the pairing step first.</string>
<string name="adb_pairing_tutorial_content_notification">A notification from Stellar will help you complete the pairing.</string>
<string name="adb_pairing_tutorial_content_steps">Enter \"Developer options\" - \"Wireless debugging\". Tap \"Pair device with pairing code\", you will see a six-digit code.</string>
<string name="adb_pairing_tutorial_content_enter_pairing_code">Enter the code in the notification to complete pairing.</string>
<string name="adb_pairing_tutorial_content_notification_blocked">The pairing process needs you to interact with a notification from Stellar. Please allow Stellar to post notifications.</string>
<string name="adb_pairing_tutorial_content_miui">MIUI users may need to switch notification style to \"Android\" from \"Notification\" - \"Notification shade\" in system settings.</string>
<string name="adb_pairing_tutorial_content_miui_2">Otherwise, you may not able to enter paring code from the notification.</string>

<string name="adb_pairing_tutorial_content_left_is_clickable">Please note that only the left part of the \"Wireless debugging\" option is clickable, tapping it will open a new page. Only toggling the switch on the right is incorrect.</string>
<string name="adb_pairing_tutorial_content_network">Stellar needs to access local network. It is controlled by the network permission.</string>

<string name="adb_pairing_tutorial_content_network_limation_not_foreground">Some systems (such as MIUI) disallow apps to access the network when they are not visible, even if the app uses foreground service as standard. Please disable battery optimization features for Stellar on such systems.</string>
You can refer to %s.]]>
<string name="home_app_management_empty">Apps that has requested or declared Stellar will show here.</string>
<string name="home_learn_more_description">Learn how to develop with Stellar</string>
<string name="home_adb_is_limited_title">You need to take an extra step</string>

<string name="home_adb_is_limited_description">Your device manufacturer has restricted adb permissions and apps using Stellar will not work properly.

Usually, this limitation can be lifted by adjusting some options in "Developer options". Please read the help for details on how to do this.

You may need to restart Stellar for the operation to take effect.</string>
There may be a solution for your system in this document.]]>
<string name="home_terminal_description">Run commands through Stellar in terminal apps you like</string>
<string name="terminal_tutorial_1">First, Export files to any where you want. You will find two files, %1$s and %2$s.</string>

<string name="terminal_tutorial_1_description">If there are files with the same name in the selected folder, they will be deleted.\n\nThe export function uses SAF (Storage Access Framework). It\'s reported that MIUI breaks the functions of SAF. If you are using MIUI, you may have to extract the file from Stellar\'s apk or download from GitHub.</string>
<string name="terminal_tutorial_2">Then, use any text editor to open and edit %1$s.</string>
<string name="terminal_tutorial_2_description">For example, if you want to use Stellar in %1$s, you should replace %2$s with %3$s (%4$s is the package name of %1$s).</string>
<string name="terminal_tutorial_3">Finally, move the files to somewhere where your terminal app can access, you will be able to use %1$s to run commands through Stellar.</string>
<string name="terminal_tutorial_3_description">Some tips: grant execute permission to %1$s and add it to %2$s, you will able to use %1$s directly.</string>
<string name="settings_black_night_theme_summary">Use the pure black theme if night mode is enabled</string>
<string name="settings_translation_summary">Help us translate %s into your language</string>
<string name="settings_start_on_boot_summary">For rooted devices, Stellar is able to start automatically on boot</string>
<string name="settings_start_on_boot_wireless_summary">For rootless devices, Stellar is able to start automatically on boot with Wireless ADB</string>
<string name="settings_adb_root_summary">Operating Systems based on the userdebug builds, Stellar can have rooted debugging to start at boot.</string>
<string name="settings_tcpip_port_summary">After starting via wireless debugging, change the TCP/IP listening port of adbd.\nClick Edit. If left blank, it will be considered disabled.</string>
<string name="wireless_boot_permission_tooltip">To automatically start Stellar on boot with wireless ADB, the WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission must be granted</string>
<string name="wireless_boot_wifi_required">This feature requires Wi-Fi connection to work</string>
<string name="permission_description">Allow the app to use Stellar.</string>
<string name="permission_write_secure_settings_required">WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission is required for this feature</string>

<string name="permission_write_secure_settings_grant_info">This permission can be granted via ADB using the command:\nadb shell pm grant moe.stellar.manager android.permission.WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS</string>
<string name="start_with_root_failed">Can\'t start service because root permission is not granted or this device is not rooted.</string>
Please ask the developer of %1$s to update.]]>

%1$s has modern Stellar support, but it\'s requesting legacy Stellar. This could because Stellar is not running, please check in Stellar app.

Legacy Stellar has been deprecated since March 2019.]]>

Note

This feature requires WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS permission.

Warning

WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS is a very sensitive permission and enable it only if you know what you're doing. I'm not responsible for whatever may happen later on.

]]>

`checkServerTrusted` is empty, which could cause insecure network traffic due to trusting arbitrary TLS/SSL certificates presented by peers

Implementing a custom `X509TrustManager` is error-prone and likely to be insecure. It is likely to disable certificate validation altogether, and is non-trivial to implement correctly without calling Android's default implementation.
